entry.title: Geordie Greep (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Geordie Greep (pictured) has an accent that has been described as "geographically unclassifiable"?

entry.title: 130 West 30th Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the owner of 130 West 30th Street would have renamed the structure the "Beaver Pelt Building" if it could not be named after its architect?

entry.title: murder of Jiang Ge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the murder of Jiang Ge led to public debate in China over the actions of Jiang's roommate during her murder?

entry.title: George Willis Pack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that George Willis Pack, a Northerner and Lincoln supporter, financed a monument to Confederate governor Zebulon Vance in Asheville, North Carolina?

entry.title: The Rape of Lucretia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the painter of The Rape of Lucretia updated the ancient legend by setting the scene in the bedroom of a contemporary Italian home?

entry.title: Triste (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the projector at the Walter Reade Theater had to be modified to screen Nathaniel Dorsky's short film Triste?

entry.title: Dacrytherium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dacrytherium, literally meaning 'tear beast', was named after its "tear-pit"?

entry.title: Rajiv Lochan Temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the construction of the Rajiv Lochan Temple has been variously attributed to two mythical kings and a god?
